availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Vernon Alexander Wheat (Boyle County, Kentucky, farmer and physician)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, farmer and physician. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth B. Owens Wheat in Mercer County, Kentucky, on February 20, 1839. Father of Mary L. Wheat, Nancy J. Wheat, Georgiana A. Wheat, Joshua Wheat, Louisa B. Wheat, William O. Wheat, Richard M. Wheat, Katura Wheat, and Julia F. Wheat. Farmer in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Physician in Boyle County in 1860. Physician in Boyle County in 1863. Served the United States Volunteers as a contract surgeon.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 90B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 947.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film 000191856.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 19352.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 5, Boyle County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 57.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Boyle County, KY, July 1863, p. 22.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Roll 510, Application 274620, Certificate.
